properties.name: 3am meteorite showers
properties.description: Posted by Paigeshopeless romantic- meteoritescomforter-style picnic blankets, whiskey in plastic bottles and secret romances that shouldn\'t have happened but did. we watched one heck of an amazing meteor shower at sunnyside park lying on the grass, stayed up late just to see the stars fall down. a slow sticky august a few years ago. this boy and i still don\'t speak to eachother any more. still the only person i ever dated that won\'t talk to me. frankly i dont blame him at all.

properties.name: As far as we made it.
properties.description: Posted by Vlai44Blaine US/Canadian border crossingThe furthest we got into Canada on July 4, 2005, thanks to a CERTAIN UNRAVELED THREAD.

properties.name: Bicyclist tried to break into my car and kill me
properties.description: Posted by Wept  6th & spring, seattle, waI was at a red light, he rode his bike through traffic going the opposite way. He went through the red light toward me, hit my window on his way by, stopped his bike and proceeded to try to break my window and kick in my door. He was totally psycho. I called the cops, they said it happened all the time around there. They also said they probably wouldn\'t catch him. I saw him again that night about a mile away going through a crosswalk. I consider it a good sign that I didn\'t once have an urge to run him over.

properties.name: Intersection where a frat boy screamed lyrics at me
properties.description: Posted by WeptMy wife (fiancee at the time) and I were walking home from shopping at Fred Meyer nearby and this frat-like kid drives up and hangs almost his entire body out of his car window and yells right at us: "I AM THE GOD OF HELL FIRE! AND I BRING YOU FIRE!" about 3 times. At the time I didn\'t know this was well referenced, so thought that despite his fratness, he was a fan of Electric Hellfire Club. This greatly impressed, amazed, and kind of frightened me. We laughed for an incredibly long amount of time.

properties.name: Rear ended by puking lady
properties.description: Posted by JasonNE 22nd & Weidler, Portland, ORMy mom picked me and some friends up from school, headed home, we get rear ended at a stop sign. A little old lady stumbles out of her car holding a handkerchief over her mouth, sweating. She makes her way to the driver\'s window, and says, "Oh, I\'m so sorry, I was sick in the car, all over my lap, and it made my foot slip off the brake. Is everyone alright?"

properties.name: The Coolest Place in the World
properties.description: Posted by CecilkleakinsThis small meadow was called "The Coolest Place in the World" by a group of punk rock teenagers in the late 1980\'s. Nothing is here, really. Just a quiet bit of grassland with some trees. Good for: guitar strumming, opium smoking, spinning around aimlessly, cloud watching.

properties.name: Where I almost got mugged
properties.description: Posted by JaheadIt was around 12 am and very dark in November 1994. I was walking home after hanging out with some people. A guy on a bicycle and a guy on foot were approaching. I crossed the street because they were being loud (and were seemingly drunk). I didn\'t want to interact with them. Then, just as we reached each other, one of them ran across the street and pushed me. I was stunned. I just stood there. I had my backpack with me and the guy on the bicycle said, "Don\'t bother this guy dude, he doesn\'t have anything." Then they just continued down Beaver Street.

properties.name: Where I reached my hand into the front pocket of a homeless guy's wet jeans
properties.description: Posted by Hivein front of the Lovejoy Market on NW 23rd Ave.This homeless guy was having trouble getting his wallet out of his pocket, he asked me for help, i tried to reach into his pocket, but half way in i realized his pants were soaking wet (don\'t ask), "ah man, it\'s all wet in there" I say, "it\'s too slippery, you\'re just gonna have to keep tryin, sorry."

properties.name: Where someone helped me change my flat tire
properties.description: Posted by Susieq1001Denver International AirportI came back from a trip and walked up to my car, to find a flat tire. A total stranger offered help (OK, I really do know how to change a tire, but he was cute.)
